homes_hear_details: Pennsylvania has launched its HOMES and HEAR rebate programs under the Inflation Reduction Act. The Pennsylvania Department of Environmental Protection (DEP) is administering the programs, providing rebates for whole-home energy efficiency improvements and high-efficiency electric equipment.
state_energy_office: Pennsylvania Department of Environmental Protection - Energy Programs Office

income_thresholds.low_income_80_ami: For Pennsylvania, 80% of Area Median Income varies by county. In Philadelphia County, 80% AMI for a family of four is approximately $65,400. In Allegheny County (Pittsburgh), it is approximately $64,150.
income_thresholds.moderate_income_150_ami: For Pennsylvania, 150% of Area Median Income varies by county. In Philadelphia County, 150% AMI for a family of four is approximately $122,650. In Allegheny County (Pittsburgh), it is approximately $120,300.

net_metering: Pennsylvania has net metering rules for systems up to 50 kW for residential customers. Customers receive credit at the full retail rate for excess generation. Credits carry forward at the price-to-compare rate and any annual excess is compensated at the price-to-compare rate.

state_rebate_programs.name: Pennsylvania Whole Home Rebate Program (HOMES)
state_rebate_programs.amount: Up to $8,000 for low-income households, up to $4,000 for moderate-income households for whole-home efficiency improvements
state_rebate_programs.eligible_items: Whole-home energy efficiency retrofits including insulation, air sealing, HVAC upgrades, windows, and doors
state_rebate_programs.details: Rebates based on modeled or measured energy savings, with higher rebates available for low and moderate-income households.

state_rebate_programs.name: Weatherization Assistance Program
state_rebate_programs.administrator: Pennsylvania Department of Community and Economic Development (DCED)
state_rebate_programs.amount: Average expenditure of approximately $7,500 per home
state_rebate_programs.eligible_items: Insulation, air sealing, heating system repair or replacement, windows, doors, health and safety improvements
state_rebate_programs.details: Federally funded program for income-qualifying households at or below 200% of federal poverty level. Administered through local weatherization agencies.

programs.name: PECO Residential Energy Efficiency Rebates
programs.amount: Up to $500 for heat pumps, $200 for smart thermostats, $250 for insulation, $50-$150 for ENERGY STAR appliances
programs.eligible_items: High-efficiency HVAC systems, heat pumps, smart thermostats, insulation, ENERGY STAR appliances, LED lighting

programs.name: PECO Home Energy Assessment
programs.amount: Free or reduced-cost home energy assessment
programs.eligible_items: Comprehensive home energy evaluation with energy-saving recommendations and free direct-install measures

programs.name: PPL Residential Rebate Programs
programs.amount: Up to $500 for heat pumps, $300 for insulation, $100 for smart thermostats
programs.eligible_items: High-efficiency HVAC, heat pumps, heat pump water heaters, smart thermostats, insulation

programs.name: Duquesne Light Watt Choices Residential Rebates
programs.amount: Up to $500 for HVAC, $200 for insulation, $100 for smart thermostats
programs.eligible_items: High-efficiency heat pumps, central air conditioners, insulation, smart thermostats, ENERGY STAR appliances
